pageContext.claim: “And over that, with 196 to nothing vote by the Republicans -- not one dissenting Republican vote -- dishonest Democrats impeached a President of the United States.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump keeps making a confusing reference to the impeachment vote, suggesting he won something by a vote of 197 or 196 to nothing. But he lost. He appears to referring to the House Republicans who supported him; all did except for a former Republican, Rep. Justin Amash of Michigan. But he lost in the Democratic-controlled House, which voted 232-196 in October in favor of the Democrats' proposed rules for the impeachment inquiry. The House voted 230-197 and 229-198 in December on the two articles of impeachment. In the Senate, one Republican, Mitt Romney of Utah, voted to convict Trump and remove him from office.
